questions.question: Si A est une matrice 2x2, alors le déterminant de A est nul si :
options: Les colonnes de A sont linéairement indépendantes
Les lignes de A sont linéairement dépendantes
Le rang de A est maximal
questions.correct_answer: Les lignes de A sont linéairement dépendantes

questions.question: Le produit de deux matrices inversibles est :
options: Inversible si et seulement si les matrices sont diagonales
Inversible si les matrices sont carrées

questions.question: Le rang d'une matrice correspond à :
options: Le nombre de lignes non nulles
Le nombre maximal de vecteurs linéairement indépendants
Le nombre de solutions du système associé
questions.correct_answer: Le nombre maximal de vecteurs linéairement indépendants

questions.question: Le polynôme caractéristique d'une matrice carrée est :
options: Le polynôme obtenu en prenant le déterminant de (A - λI)
Le produit des valeurs propres de la matrice
Le polynôme dont les racines sont les valeurs propres de A
questions.correct_answer: Le polynôme obtenu en prenant le déterminant de (A - λI)

questions.question: Une matrice est dite diagonalisable si :
options: Elle a une base de vecteurs propres
questions.correct_answer: Elle a une base de vecteurs propres

questions.question: Les valeurs propres d'une matrice sont les racines de :
Le déterminant d'une matrice triangulaire est :
options: La somme des éléments de la diagonale
Le produit des éléments de la diagonale
questions.correct_answer: Le produit des éléments de la diagonale

questions.question: Si A est une matrice inversible, alors A^(-1) est :
options: La matrice obtenue en permutant les lignes et colonnes de A
La matrice qui, multipliée par A, donne l'identité
questions.correct_answer: La matrice qui, multipliée par A, donne l'identité

What does OOP stand for?
What is a class in OOP?
options: A method that performs an action

questions.question: What is an object in OOP?
options: A method that performs an action

questions.question: What is a constructor?
options: A method used to delete an object
A special method used to initialize objects
A method used to access private variables
questions.correct_answer: A special method used to initialize objects

questions.question: Which concept allows you to hide implementation details and show only functionality?
What is a destructor in OOP?
options: A function called to initialize an object
A function called to destroy an object
questions.correct_answer: A function called to destroy an object

questions.question: What is function overloading?
options: Using the same function name with different parameters
Defining multiple classes with the same name
Assigning multiple return types to a single function
questions.correct_answer: Using the same function name with different parameters

questions.question: What is meant by overriding in OOP?
options: Redefining a base class method in a derived class
Using the same name for multiple functions
Accessing private members of a class
questions.correct_answer: Redefining a base class method in a derived class

questions.question: Which of the following languages use Object-Oriented Programming?
Which OOP concept involves creating a new class based on an existing class?
What is the difference between an interface and an abstract class in OOP?
options: An interface can have both abstract and concrete methods, while an abstract class can only have abstract methods
An interface can only have abstract methods, while an abstract class can have both abstract and concrete methods
An interface is used for inheritance, while an abstract class is used for polymorphism
An interface is used for polymorphism, while an abstract class is used for inheritance
questions.correct_answer: An interface can only have abstract methods, while an abstract class can have both abstract and concrete methods

questions.question: How does encapsulation contribute to code security in OOP?
options: By exposing all data to external access
By hiding data and exposing methods, thus controlling access to data
By creating multiple objects from a single class
By overriding methods in child classes
questions.correct_answer: By hiding data and exposing methods, thus controlling access to data

questions.question: What is the difference between a static method and an instance method in OOP?
options: A static method belongs to a class and can be called without creating an instance, while an instance method belongs to an object and requires an instance to be called.
A static method belongs to an object and requires an instance to be called, while an instance method belongs to a class and can be called without creating an instance.
A static method is used for hiding data, while an instance method is used for exposing methods.
A static method is used for exposing methods, while an instance method is used for hiding data.
questions.correct_answer: A static method belongs to a class and can be called without creating an instance, while an instance method belongs to an object and requires an instance to be called.

It can be used as a standalone class for instantiation
questions.correct_answer: Objects of the class cannot be created, but it can be inherited

To specify the code to be executed regardless of whether an exception occurs or not
To catch and handle specific exceptions
questions.correct_answer: To specify the code to be executed regardless of whether an exception occurs or not

questions.question: Which of the following statements is used to raise a custom exception in Python?

To skip the execution of the block if an exception occurs

questions.question: How can you catch multiple exceptions in a single except block?
options: Using a comma-separated list of exceptions

questions.correct_answer: To check if a given expression is true, otherwise raise an 'AssertionError'

questions.question: What does the finally block execute if an exception is raised and not caught?
options: It executes before the exception is raised
It executes after the exception is raised
It executes only if the exception is caught
questions.correct_answer: It executes after the exception is raised

questions.question: How can you handle exceptions globally in Python?
options: By modifying the global exception settings in the `sys` module
There is no way to handle exceptions globally
questions.correct_answer: By modifying the global exception settings in the `sys` module

questions.question: In Python, what does the sys.exc_info() function return?
